metadata.title: CVE-2023-2162 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability was found in iscsi_sw_tcp_session_create indrivers/scsi/iscsi_tcp.c in SCSI sub-component in the Linux Kernel. In thisflaw an attacker could leak kernel internal information.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-2162` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-18-generic - 6.2.0-18.18
linux-image-6.2.0-18-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-18.18
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-18-generic - 6.2.0-18.18
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-18-generic-64k - 6.2.0-18.18
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1002-kvm - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1002-aws - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1002-azure - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1004-gcp - 6.2.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1001-ibm - 6.2.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1002-lowlatency - 6.2.0-1002.2
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1002-lowlatency-64k - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1002-oracle - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1003-raspi - 6.2.0-1003.3
linux-image-6.2.0-1003-raspi-nolpae - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1002-starfive - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required
